title: Discrimination in Oceanic Amatuer Tournaments!

embed.description: This is an invitational event. The ELO cap for this competition is platinum 1. HOW TO SIGN UP: Teams are to send applications in to oceaniclolfb@gmail.com with the following information Team Name Player names and IGN substitutes: 3 max. Once the application has been received a panel of Oceanic LoL admins will choose 8 teams to compete and invite.

body:
I was checking out the new tournaments page that popped up in the client and thought,
great this is cool. I'm interested in doing joining some!

To read that because I have a good solo que elo I'm not allowed to compete????

I'm honestly really offended, and confused as to how such rules would be allowed to slip past riot employees.

Thoughts/comments guys?

A response from someone more involved in the oce tournaments scene would be appreciated.

These are community run events. It's not really anything to do with relation to Riot allowing it to slip past.

I have run tournaments in the past and I know that sometimes there will be the same high level players compete and ultimately win each tournament. This doesn't work very well on giving new or lower ranked players competitive experience and an honest chance at playing a few rounds.

This is labelled as an amateur tournaments, so they are wanting to give those lower ranked players a go at gaining some much needed experience, which helps the region grow as it can increase the number of skilled players.

Hope this helps.

this is  awesome point and i believe every word said here is true but id like to add on that maybe (like pancake said) add a tournament where its bronze vs bronze silver v silver etc. that would be really fun, and maybe the higher the elo the bigger the prize. (btw i have recently played a game with you which i find pretty cool :D )

Haha, that's awesome man. Did I do well? 0.0

That would also be another good way to do tournaments, sure. There are a few things you need to factor in on this though. People will need to make teams with people they know in the same elo (silver people may frequently play with friends in gold but won't be allowed for this tournament), it may also limit the amount of people entering the tournament.

It's a good idea and the thing is, there is nothing stopping anyone who has these ideas from organising a tournament themselves :)

but a person with these idea also needs the place, money and time to run these things and they are all things i don't have :c but it would be awesome to increase the competitive scene in OCE and also give bronze/silver/ gold players the confidence to get better and to also have a chance :D

For a physical tournament, yes it is quite a bit harder. However for an online tournament you can use programs such as challonge to run the brackets, you don't need to use any of your money. All you really need is a bit of time and the passion :).

If you are actually wanting to run a tournament, let me know, happy to answer any questions you may have about how to get one started up. :)

I'm aware that the tournament is not hosted by riot itself, but it does have to receive approval/authorisation in some way
by having the skin reward/being posted on the offical events page I would assume? 
And although trying to ensure that games are fun
and fair by considering skill level is a sensible idea, banning people who have achieved a certain rank in solo que just can't be the way to go!

Players part of a pro team/the challenger series or something being not welcome makes sense, its an amateur tournament. Great.
But does winning a few solo que games make you a pro? I don't think so. You'll find most solo que players are amateurs in 5s.

And flip it the other way, lets say they decided bronze players weren't welcome because they don't want to waste anyones time/have "better"  games.
Plenty of people would be upset by that.

Its an invitational, so discretion can/will be used in deciding which teams will play can be used. If a team on paper looks amazingly good/not in the spirit of the competiton by being full of challenger solo que players with experience in ranked 5s too then they could perhaps decide another team is a better fit.

But as it is now, its just... I have a hard trouble decribing it without bad mouthing whoever's in charge.

Edit:  Quick note, this is hardly effective when you think about smurfing. You can't really confirm if someone has another account at a higher MMR nor is assuming people are smurfs because they play particularly well anything less than the height of stupidity.
